item.title: LECTURER – A LEVEL CHEMISTRY
item.description:
East Sussex College is a people-centric, values-driven, ambitious and inclusive Further Education College with over 1,300 colleagues and over 5500 students. We offer a broad curriculum including A Levels, T-levels, work based, 14-19, HE and adult programmes with campuses in Eastbourne, Hastings, Lewes and Newhaven.  This is an exciting time to join us as we grow and develop even stronger pathways for our students and communities. 

LECTURER – A LEVEL CHEMISTRY

College location: Lewes

Annual salary: £25,835 - £39,808 (Subject to qualifications, skills and experience)

Hours: Full time, 37 hours per week, permanent contract.

Ongoing recruitment.

This exciting role will include:

  • delivering A Level Chemistry, as well as our tutorial programme
  • Implementing a student’s support plan and safety assessment
  • Working within a team of friendly multidisciplinary professionals across the college to support our students
  • Help track the progress of individuals and reporting to the teacher and/or parents at review meetings

If you can demonstrate the following, then we’d love to hear from you:

  • excellent communication and organisational skills
  • a relevant degree (we also welcome applications from NQTs)
  • if you have not yet started your teaching career, we would welcome applications from recent graduates of Chemistry. You would benefit from working alongside an experienced team who would guide and mentor you and we would also support you in gaining a PGCE
  • proven track record of high-quality teaching and successful student outcomes
  • clear understanding of the importance of raising the standard of teaching by using a range of strategies to raise achievement
  • understanding of the importance of monitoring student progress and the effective use of student data systems to intervene and raise standards

In return, we can offer you:

A competitive FE salary, generous annual leave & pension, access to funded teaching qualifications, apprenticeships and a range of other training courses to support career development, as well as many other benefits.

To Apply and view the Job Description & Person Specification, please register or log in and complete the online form via the 'Apply' link below.

Alternatively, you can request an application form, send your CV and covering letter, or arrange an appointment to chat informally about the role by emailing peopleservices@escg.ac.uk

OTHER INFORMATION:

•(ESC PROUD VALUES) POSITIVITY – RESPECT – OPPORTUNITY – UNITY - DIVERSITY

• East Sussex College is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children.

Application & Safeguarding process:

• We are committed to ensuring our colleague recruitment process is accessible for all candidates.   If you require adjustments or support to fully engage with any aspect of the process, please get in touch with people services who will be happy to facilitate reasonable adaptions (peopleservices@escg.ac.uk). 

• Applicants should be eligible to work in the UK, work permits from other organisations are not acceptable as proof of right to work in the UK.

• Prior to interview all shortlisted candidates will be asked to complete an Application Form (including explanation of any gaps in employment), a Self-Declaration and Disclosure form and we will carry out an online check.

• Please note that it is an offence to apply for a role at a college if you are barred from engaging in regulated activity.

• If offered a role with us, as part of our pre-employment checks an enhanced DBS, references and evidence of qualifications will be required.

•Applications may be shortlisted on a rolling basis and we reserve the right to interview and appoint before the closing date.

DEIB commitment (Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging):

•We embrace the individuality of every person in our community. 

•We continue to cultivate a people-centric culture where everyone in our college can be their authentic selves, welcoming broad perspectives and implementing initiatives to continue ensuring the college is an equitable and inclusive workplace.

•The college is committed to attracting and retaining a diverse mix of colleagues who are representative of the diversity in our local communities, considering positive action and reasonable adjustments to address any under-representation where suitable.

• ESC particularly encourages applications from black and minority ethnic communities, people with disabilities, males and those who identify as LGBTQIA+ who are currently under represented staff groups.

Recruitment Agencies

We prefer to hire our people directly, but we do have a preferred supplier list for when we require additional support. We will be in touch if we need you.

item.title: LEARNING SUPPORT ASSISTANT
item.description:
East Sussex College is a people-centric, values-driven, ambitious and inclusive Further Education College with over 1,300 colleagues and over 5500 students. We offer a broad curriculum including A Levels, T-levels, work based, 14-19, HE and adult programmes with campuses in Eastbourne, Hastings, Lewes and Newhaven.  This is an exciting time to join us as we grow and develop even stronger pathways for our students and communities.  

LEARNING SUPPORT ASSISTANT
College location: Lewes
Annual salary: Circa £10,319 per annum (FTE salary £23,724 per annum).
Hours: 20 hours per week, term-time only, 36 weeks per year, permanent contract.
Closing date: 15th December 2024.

Interviews wil take plce in early/mid January 2025.

This exciting role will include:
•    helping us to provide individualised support services at our Lewes campus
•    providing 1:1 support, assistance and encouragement from hand over in the morning and during lessons and breaktimes
•    you will facilitate and assist the student in the classroom and other learning environments and in safely navigating around the college environment through close support and supervision, including physical assistance and or personal care as and when necessary
•    you will help to facilitate the development and/or use of receptive and expressive communication skills by the student and be a key link between the class tutor and the learner and parents/ carers in order to encourage independence and confidence to participate in all elements of their study programme.  

If you can demonstrate the following, then we’d love to hear from you: 
•    an inclusive and collaborative approach in providing one to one support to students who may have complex needs including learning difficulties (e.g Autism) and / or medical needs / physical disabilities (e.g. Epilepsy or Cerebral Palsy)
•    whilst desirable, experience in an education setting is not everything!  In fact, this is an excellent way to start your career in education and build the experience you need
•    we know that if you have the motivation and desire to learn, and the want to empower others, you already have the foundations of an outstanding Student Support Team member

In return, we can offer you:
A competitive FE salary, generous annual leave & pension, access to funded teaching qualifications, apprenticeships and a range of other training courses to support career development, as well as many other benefits.

To Apply and view the Job Description & Person Specification, please register or log in and complete the online form via the 'Apply' link below. 
Alternatively, you can request an application form, send your CV and covering letter, or arrange an appointment to chat informally about the role by emailing peopleservices@escg.ac.uk 

OTHER INFORMATION:
•(ESC PROUD VALUES) POSITIVITY – RESPECT – OPPORTUNITY – UNITY - DIVERSITY

• We are committed to ensuring our colleague recruitment process is accessible for all candidates.   If you require adjustments or support to fully engage with any aspect of the process, please get in touch with people services who will be happy to facilitate reasonable adaptions (peopleservices@escg.ac.uk). 
• Applicants should be eligible to work in the UK, work permits from other organisations are not acceptable as proof of right to work in the UK.
• Prior to interview all shortlisted candidates will be asked to complete an Application Form (including explanation of any gaps in employment), a Self-Declaration and Disclosure form and we will carry out an online check.
• Please note that it is an offence to apply for a role at a college if you are barred from engaging in regulated activity.
• If offered a role with us, as part of our pre-employment checks an enhanced DBS, references and evidence of qualifications will be required.
•Applications may be shortlisted on a rolling basis and we reserve the right to interview and appoint before the closing date.
DEIB commitment (Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging):
•We embrace the individuality of every person in our community. 
•We continue to cultivate a people-centric culture where everyone in our college can be their authentic selves, welcoming broad perspectives and implementing initiatives to continue ensuring the college is an equitable and inclusive workplace.
•The college is committed to attracting and retaining a diverse mix of colleagues who are representative of the diversity in our local communities, considering positive action and reasonable adjustments to address any under-representation where suitable.
• ESC particularly encourages applications from black and minority ethnic communities, people with disabilities, males and those who identify as LGBTQIA+ who are currently under represented staff groups.

item.title: FACILITIES MANAGER
item.description:
East Sussex College is a people-centric, values-driven, ambitious and inclusive Further Education College with over 1,300 colleagues and over 5500 students. We offer a broad curriculum including A Levels, T-levels, work based, 14-19, HE and adult programmes with campuses in Eastbourne, Hastings, Lewes and Newhaven.  This is an exciting time to join us as we grow and develop even stronger pathways for our students and communities.  

FACILITIES MANAGER
College location: Hastings
Annual salary: Circa £32,947 per annum.
Hours: Full time, 37 hurs per week, full year, permanent contract.
Closing date: 6th December 2024.

This exciting role will include:

- leading the Estates Team, providing a full Facilities Management service

- ensuring that the campus, buildings and grounds are welcoming and conducive to an outstanding Teaching and Learning environment.

If you can demonstrate the following, then we’d love to hear from you: 

The post holder will ideally have relevant experience in a building environment, with Supervisory experience in a premises related role.
 
We can offer you:

•    A competitive salary, a wide range of generous benefits, as well as flexible working opportunities.
•    Rewarding employment in a high performing, professional environment, working with over 1,200 like-minded and friendly colleagues.
•    Continuing Professional Development, with access to funded teaching qualifications, apprenticeships and a range of other training courses to support career development.
•    The opportunity to make a difference to the lives of students of all ages within the largest Further Education (FE) College in East Sussex (judged GOOD by Ofsted in 2021).

In return, we can offer you:
A competitive FE salary, generous annual leave & pension, access to funded teaching qualifications, apprenticeships and a range of other training courses to support career development, as well as many other benefits.

To Apply and view the Job Description & Person Specification, please register or log in and complete the online form via the 'Apply' link below.

item.title: Lecturer - Pathways
item.description:
East Sussex College is a people-centric, values-driven, ambitious and inclusive Further Education College with over 1,300 colleagues and over 5500 students. We offer a broad curriculum including A Levels, T-levels, work based, 14-19, HE and adult programmes with campuses in Eastbourne, Hastings, Lewes and Newhaven.  This is an exciting time to join us as we grow and develop even stronger pathways for our students and communities.  

LECTURER in PATHWAYS INCLUSIVE LEARNING (Eastbourne Campus) 

College location: Eastbourne

Annual salary: £25,835 - £39,808

(Subject to qualifications, skills and experience)

Hours:   Full time – 37 Hours/52 Weeks

Closing date:   Thursday 12th December 2024

Interview Date: W/C 16th December 2024.

  • Do you want to support and enable young people who have learning difficulties and/or disabilities as well as barriers to learning to successfully achieve their qualifications, progress onto a programme which inspires them and become a young adult with a clear vision about their future?
  • Are you passionate about inclusion and be able to deliver a range of subjects which could include functional skills maths and English as well as employability skills, personal and social development and vocational pathways 

This exciting role will include:

  • Working in a person centred multi-disciplinary approach to support learners with complex additional needs including social emotional and mental health support needs and/or learning difficulties, disabilities and Autism within our Sensory Learning provision. 
  • You will liaise and collaborate with curriculum staff to devise a curriculum which enriches the learning experience and raises the aspirations of the learners and you will support the continual development of the area by contributing to departmental planning and team meetings.
  • You will pro-actively support young people who may need guidance and support with their behaviour to prepare them for progression onto mainstream courses.

If you can demonstrate the following then we’d love to hear from you:

  • Have high expectations for all our learners and are determined that they will exceed their aspirations. We are looking for an enthusiastic, innovative and student focused professional to join our dynamic Inclusive Learning Team. 
  • You will be an excellent communicator and have strong organisational skills as well as having experience of working with young people who have learning difficulties and/or disabilities as well as behaviour which could be described as challenging.
  • You should have a relevant degree (or equivalent), a teaching qualification, post-qualification experience and a student-centred approach to teaching and learning.
  • For many of our teaching roles, we welcome applications from candidates at any stage of their career, including industry professionals with no/limited teaching experience.  We are able to offer teacher development & qualifications to enable teaching success. 

In return, we can offer you:

A competitive FE salary, generous annual leave & pension, access to funded teaching qualifications, apprenticeships and a range of other training courses to support career development, as well as many other benefits.

 To Apply and view the Job Description & Person Specification, please register or log in and complete the online form via the 'Apply' link below.

 

Alternatively, you can request an application form, send your CV and covering letter, or arrange an appointment to chat informally about the role by emailing peopleservices@escg.ac.uk.

 

OTHER INFORMATION:

•(ESC PROUD VALUES) POSITIVITY – RESPECT – OPPORTUNITY – UNITY - DIVERSITY

• East Sussex College is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children.

Application & Safeguarding process:

• We are committed to ensuring our colleague recruitment process is accessible for all candidates.   If you require adjustments or support to fully engage with any aspect of the process, please get in touch with people services who will be happy to facilitate reasonable adaptions (peopleservices@escg.ac.uk).  

• Applicants should be eligible to work in the UK, work permits from other organisations are not acceptable as proof of right to work in the UK.

• Prior to interview all shortlisted candidates will be asked to complete an Application Form (including explanation of any gaps in employment), a Self-Declaration and Disclosure form and we will carry out an online check.

• Please note that it is an offence to apply for a role at a college if you are barred from engaging in regulated activity.

• If offered a role with us, as part of our pre-employment checks an enhanced DBS, references and evidence of qualifications will be required.

•Applications may be shortlisted on a rolling basis and we reserve the right to interview and appoint before the closing date.

DEIB commitment (Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging):

•We embrace the individuality of every person in our community. 

•We continue to cultivate a people-centric culture where everyone in our college can be their authentic selves, welcoming broad perspectives and implementing initiatives to continue ensuring the college is an equitable and inclusive workplace.

•The college is committed to attracting and retaining a diverse mix of colleagues who are representative of the diversity in our local communities, considering positive action and reasonable adjustments to address any under-representation where suitable.

• ESC particularly encourages applications from black and minority ethnic communities, people with disabilities, males and those who identify as LGBTQIA+ who are currently under represented staff groups.

We prefer to hire our people directly, but we do have a preferred supplier list for when we require additional support. We will be in touch if we need you.

item.title: Lecturer - Maths (Apprenticeships)
item.description:
East Sussex College is a people-centric, values-driven, ambitious and inclusive Further Education College with over 1,300 colleagues and over 5500 students. We offer a broad curriculum including A Levels, T-levels, work based, 14-19, HE and adult programmes with campuses in Eastbourne, Hastings, Lewes and Newhaven.  This is an exciting time to join us as we grow and develop even stronger pathways for our students and communities.  

 

Lecturer – Maths

 

College location: Hastings Campuses (Ore Valley)

Annual salary: £25,835 - £39,808 (FTE)

(Subject to qualifications, skills and experience)

Hours:   Part Time – 20 Hours / 52 Weeks (Please refer to timetable.)

Closing date:   5th January 2025

Interview Date: W/C 13TH January 2025

 

  • Are you looking for a role working with apprentices?  Do you want support students with their key skills alongside ?

 

This exciting role will include:

  • Delivery of GCSE & Functional Skills around main curriculum timetable.
  • Supporting students to achieve their core subjects.

 

If you can demonstrate the following then we’d love to hear from you:

  • Experienced maths teacher
  • Ability to deliver both in person and virtually.
  • Excellent planning skills
  • For many of our teaching roles, we welcome applications from candidates at any stage of their career, including industry professionals with no/limited teaching experience.  We are able to offer teacher development & qualifications to enable teaching success. 

In return, we can offer you:

A competitive FE salary, generous annual leave & pension, access to funded teaching qualifications, apprenticeships and a range of other training courses to support career development, as well as many other benefits.

item.title: Restaurant Manager
item.description:
East Sussex College is a people-centric, values-driven, ambitious and inclusive Further Education College with over 1,300 colleagues and over X students. We offer a broad curriculum including A Levels, T-levels, work based, 14-19, HE and adult programmes with campuses in Eastbourne, Hastings, Lewes and Newhaven.  This is an exciting time to join us as we grow and develop even stronger pathways for our students and communities.  

 

Restaurant Manager

 

College location: Based at our Eastbourne Campus.

Annual salary: Circa £5600 (Circa £31k FTE)

(Subject to qualifications, skills and experience)

Hours:   Part-time, 7.5 Hours/40 Weeks

Closing date:   12th December 2024

Interview Date: W/C 16th December 2024

 

  • Are you passionate about hospitality? Do you want to shape the future of the industry?

 

This exciting role will include:

    • Collaborate with the Food & Beverage Lecturer to support practical training lessons for students.
    • Facilitate food and beverage service during lunch and occasional dinners for guests and clients.
    • Supervise students, empowering them to take ownership of their service and learning experience.
    • Assist with guest bookings, finance, and cash handling operations behind the scenes.
    • Ensure consistent application of safe food handling practices and proper documentation.

If you can demonstrate the following then we’d love to hear from you:

  • - Strong organisational skills and excellent planning abilities.
  • - Experience in the food and beverage industry, ideally in a training or educational environment.
  • - A collaborative mindset and commitment to fostering a supportive learning atmosphere.
  • -Team player through and through to work as part of our extended business service industries team 

 

In return, we can offer you:

A competitive FE salary, generous annual leave & pension, access to funded teaching qualifications, apprenticeships and a range of other training courses to support career development, as well as many other benefits.

To Apply and view the Job Description & Person Specification, please register or log in and complete the online form via the 'Apply' link below.

 

Alternatively, you can request an application form, send your CV and covering letter, or arrange an appointment to chat informally about the role by emailing peopleservices@escg.ac.uk.

item.title: Science Technician (VSP)
item.description:
East Sussex College is a people-centric, values-driven, ambitious and inclusive Further Education College with over 1,300 colleagues and over 5500 students. We offer a broad curriculum including A Levels, T-levels, work based, 14-19, HE and adult programmes with campuses in Eastbourne, Hastings, Lewes and Newhaven.  This is an exciting time to join us as we grow and develop even stronger pathways for our students and communities.  

 

Science Technician (VSP)

 

College location: Based at our Ore Valley Campus

Salary; Circa £23,700 FTE (£4800 Pro Rata)

Hours:   Part-time, 7.5 hours/week

Closing date: 12th December 2024

Interview Date: W/C 16th December 2024

 

  • Are you looking for a part time position utilising your science knowledge?

 

This important role will include:

  • Preparing materials for laboratory activities.
  • Safe and orderly organisation of laboratory materials.
  • Maintaining laboratory equipment
  • Maintaining up to date risk assessments
  • Supporting tutors in preparing lesson materials.

 

If you can demonstrate the following then we’d love to hear from you:

  • A level qualifications (minimum) in science based subject
  • Effective organisational skills
  • Ability to work independently
  • Experience of laboratory practices (preferred)

In return, we can offer you:

Good working environment with supportive, friendly team

item.title: LECTURER - ECONOMICS
item.description:
East Sussex College is a people-centric, values-driven, ambitious and inclusive Further Education College with over 1,300 colleagues and over 5000 students. We offer a broad curriculum including A Levels, T-levels, work based, 14-19, HE and adult programmes with campuses in Eastbourne, Hastings, Lewes and Newhaven.  This is an exciting time to join us as we grow and develop even stronger pathways for our students and communities.  

Lecturer - Economics

College location: Based at our Lewes 

Annual salary: 25,835.00 - £39,808.00 FTE

(Flexibility for an exceptional candidate, subject to qualifications, skills and experience)

Hours: Part Time, 14 hours per week.

Interview Date: TBC

Role

Due to the continuing growth of our A Level department, an enthusiastic, well-qualified and experienced professional is required to join our team.

The postholder will be required to deliver A Level Economics, Years 1 and 2. Excellent communication and organisational skills should be matched by a proven track record of high-quality teaching and successful student outcomes.

Successful candidates will have a clear understanding of the importance of raising the standard of teaching by using a range of strategies to raise achievement. An understanding of the importance of monitoring student progress and the effective use of student data systems to intervene and raise standards are also essential for this post. 

Candidates should have a relevant degree and we welcome applications from NQTs.

In return, we can offer you:

A competitive FE salary, generous annual leave & pension, access to funded teaching qualifications, apprenticeships and a range of other training courses to support career development, as well as many other benefits.

To Apply and view the Job Description & Person Specification, please register or log in and complete the online form via the 'Apply' link below.

Alternatively, you can request an application form, send your CV and covering letter, or arrange an appointment to chat informally about the role by emailing peopleservices@escg.ac.uk.

OTHER INFORMATION:

•(ESC PROUD VALUES) POSITIVITY – RESPECT – OPPORTUNITY – UNITY - DIVERSITY

Application & Safeguarding process:

• Applicants should be eligible to work in the UK, work permits from other organisations are not acceptable as proof of right to work in the UK.

• Prior to interview all shortlisted candidates will be asked to complete an Application Form (including explanation of any gaps in employment), a Self-Declaration and Disclosure form and we will carry out an online check.

• Please note that it is an offence to apply for a role at a college if you are barred from engaging in regulated activity.

• If offered a role with us, as part of our pre-employment checks an enhanced DBS, references and evidence of qualifications will be required.

•Applications may be shortlisted on a rolling basis and we reserve the right to interview and appoint before the closing date.

DEIB commitment (Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging):

•We embrace the individuality of every person in our community. 

•We continue to cultivate a people-centric culture where everyone in our college can be their authentic selves, welcoming broad perspectives and implementing initiatives to continue ensuring the college is an equitable and inclusive workplace.

•The college is committed to attracting and retaining a diverse mix of colleagues who are representative of the diversity in our local communities, considering positive action and reasonable adjustments to address any under-representation where suitable.

• ESC particularly encourages applications from black and minority ethnic communities, people with disabilities, males and those who identify as LGBTQIA+ who are currently under represented staff groups.

We are committed to ensuring our colleague recruitment process is accessible for all candidates.   If you require adjustments or support to fully engage with any aspect of the process, please do get in touch with people services who will be happy to facilitate reasonable adaptions.  

Recruitment Agencies

We prefer to hire our people directly, but we do have a preferred supplier list for when we require additional support. We will be in touch if we need you.

item.title: LECTURER – A LEVEL COMPUTER SCIENCE
item.description:
East Sussex College is a people-centric, values-driven, ambitious and inclusive Further Education College with over 1,300 colleagues and over 5500 students. We offer a broad curriculum including A Levels, T-levels, work based, 14-19, HE and adult programmes with campuses in Eastbourne, Hastings, Lewes and Newhaven.  This is an exciting time to join us as we grow and develop even stronger pathways for our students and communities.  

LECTURER – A LEVEL COMPUTER SCIENCE
College location: Lewes
Annual salary: £25835 to £39808 per annum, subject to qualifications, experience & skills (pro rata for part time).
Hours: Part time, 14 hours per week, full year, permanent contract. 
Closing date: ongoing recruitment.
 
This exciting role will include:

•    Teaching Year 1 and Year 2 A Level Computer Science and could potentially be increased to include A Level Maths.
•    Develop and update course materials to reflect current industry standards and practices.
•    Supporting students in achieving their qualifications and career goals.
•    Maintaining accurate records of student progress and achievements.
•    Participating in team meetings and contribute to the continuous improvement of our courses.

If you can demonstrate the following, then we’d love to hear from you: 

•    Degree level qualification (or higher) within the relevant field. 
•    Teaching qualification or be currently working towards one/willing to undertake a PGCE.
•    Evidence of preparing and delivering high-quality lessons that engage students and to use differentiated objectives and formative assessment for ensuring the progress of all students.
•    Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
•    Commitment to student success and professional development.
•    Ability to work flexibly and adapt to the needs of the institution and students.

Successful candidates will also have a clear track record of securing good outcomes for students and an understanding of the importance of raising the standard of teaching, intervening and using a range of strategies to raise achievement. Knowledge and experience of monitoring student progress and effective use of student data systems to raise standards are also essential for this post.

In return, we can offer you:

A competitive FE salary, generous annual leave & pension, access to funded teaching qualifications, apprenticeships and a range of other training courses to support career development, as well as many other benefits.

This post is subject to a DBS check.

If you are interested, please use the link to complete the application form. Alternatively, you can request an application form or send your CV and covering letter by emailing peopleservices@escg.ac.uk     

OTHER INFORMATION:

•(ESC PROUD VALUES) POSITIVITY – RESPECT – OPPORTUNITY – UNITY - DIVERSITY

• East Sussex College is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children.

Application process:

• We are committed to ensuring our colleague recruitment process is accessible for all candidates.   If you require adjustments or support to fully engage with any aspect of the process, please get in touch with people services who will be happy to facilitate reasonable adaptions (peopleservices@escg.ac.uk). 

• Applicants should be eligible to work in the UK, work permits from other organisations are not acceptable as proof of right to work in the UK.

• Prior to interview all shortlisted candidates will be asked to complete an Application Form (including explanation of any gaps in employment), a Self-Declaration and Disclosure form and we will carry out an online check.

• If offered a role with us, as part of our pre-employment checks an enhanced DBS, references and evidence of qualifications will be required.

•Applications may be shortlisted on a rolling basis and we reserve the right to interview and appoint before the closing date.

DEIB commitment (Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging):

•We embrace the individuality of every person in our community. 

•We continue to cultivate a people-centric culture where everyone in our college can be their authentic selves, welcoming broad perspectives and implementing initiatives to continue ensuring the college is an equitable and inclusive workplace.

•The college is committed to attracting and retaining a diverse mix of colleagues who are representative of the diversity in our local communities, considering positive action and reasonable adjustments to address any under-representation where suitable.

• ESC particularly encourages applications from black and minority ethnic communities, people with disabilities, males and those who identify as LGBTQIA+ who are currently under-represented staff groups.

item.title: Exams Administrator
item.description:
East Sussex College is a people-centric, values-driven, ambitious and inclusive Further Education College with over 1,300 colleagues and over 5500 students. We offer a broad curriculum including A Levels, T-levels, work based, 14-19, HE and adult programmes with campuses in Eastbourne, Hastings, Lewes and Newhaven.  This is an exciting time to join us as we grow and develop even stronger pathways for our students and communities.  

 

EXAMINATIONS ADMINISTRATOR

 

College location: Based at our Hastings Campus

Annual salary: Circa £23,700

(Subject to qualifications, skills and experience)

Hours:   37 Hours / 52 week – Full Time

Closing date:   Wednesday 15th January

Interview Date: Wednesday 22nd January

 

  • Are you looking for a varied, interesting and busy administrative role in a friendly Department?
  •  Do you want to ensure we provide a positive student experience that is a vital part of their learning journey?

 

This exciting role will include:

  • Overseeing and organising the registration, examination and certification of student’s qualifications across the Hastings campus, including A levels, T levels, BTECS and GCSEs, as well as the Vocational Qualifications we deliver on campus
  • Having to work to various deadlines with different Awarding Bodies, so good organisational skills are essential.
  • A variety of tasks throughout the year that can be, at times, complex and multi-faceted.

 

If you can demonstrate the following then we’d love to hear from you:

  • Excellent attention to detail and have experience of accurate data processing
  • Good working knowledge of Microsoft Windows/Office and excellent IT Skills
  • Good customer service skills, as you will be dealing directly with tutors, students and parents

In return, we can offer you:

A competitive FE salary, generous annual leave & pension, access to funded teaching qualifications, apprenticeships and a range of other training courses to support career development, as well as many other benefits.

 

To Apply and view the Job Description & Person Specification, please register or log in and complete the online form via the 'Apply' link below.

 

Alternatively, you can request an application form, send your CV and covering letter, or arrange an appointment to chat informally about the role by emailing peopleservices@escg.ac.uk.

 

OTHER INFORMATION:

•(ESC PROUD VALUES) POSITIVITY – RESPECT – OPPORTUNITY – UNITY - DIVERSITY

• East Sussex College is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children.

• Please note that it is an offence to apply for a role at a college if you are barred from engaging in regulated activity.

• If offered a role with us, as part of our pre-employment checks an enhanced DBS, references and evidence of qualifications will be required.

•Applications may be shortlisted on a rolling basis and we reserve the right to interview and appoint before the closing date.

item.title: LEARNING SUPPORT ASSISTANT
item.description:
East Sussex College is a people-centric, values-driven, ambitious and inclusive Further Education College with over 1,300 colleagues and over 5500 students. We offer a broad curriculum including A Levels, T-levels, work based, 14-19, HE and adult programmes with campuses in Eastbourne, Hastings, Lewes and Newhaven.  This is an exciting time to join us as we grow and develop even stronger pathways for our students and communities.  

LEARNING SUPPORT ASSISTANT
College location: Eastbourne
Annual salary: Circa £3,354 per annum (FTE salary £23,724 per annum).
Hours: 6.5 hours per week, term-time only, 36 weeks per year, permanent contract.
Closing date: 8th December 2024.

This exciting role will include:

•    Supporting our young people in a classroom setting and during breaktime activities 
•    Implementing a student’s support plan and safety assessment 
•    Working within a team of friendly multidisciplinary professionals across the college to support our students 
•    Help track the progress of individuals and reporting to the teacher and/or parents at review meetings 

If you can demonstrate the following, then we’d love to hear from you: 

•    Whilst desirable, experience in an education setting is not everything!  In fact, this is an excellent way to start your career in education and build the experience you need
•    We know that if you have the motivation and desire to learn, and the want to empower others, you already have the foundations of an outstanding Student Support Team member. 

We can offer career development, a rewarding experience, and the opportunity for you to make a meaningful and positive difference to the prospects of young people from your local community.

In return, we can offer you:

A competitive FE salary, generous annual leave & pension, access to funded teaching qualifications, apprenticeships and a range of other training courses to support career development, as well as many other benefits.

To Apply and view the Job Description & Person Specification, please register or log in and complete the online form via the 'Apply' link below.

item.title: ASSESSOR – AAT
item.description:
East Sussex College is a people-centric, values-driven, ambitious and inclusive Further Education College with over 1,300 colleagues and over 5500 students. We offer a broad curriculum including A Levels, T-levels, work based, 14-19, HE and adult programmes with campuses in Eastbourne, Hastings, Lewes and Newhaven.  This is an exciting time to join us as we grow and develop even stronger pathways for our students and communities. 

ASSESSOR – AAT

College location: Eastbourne

Annual salary: Circa £18,029 per annum (FTE salary £29,003 per annum).

Hours: 23 hours per week, full year, permanent contract.

Closing date: 5th December 2024.

Interviews provisionally planned for 9th December 2024.

This exciting role will include:

  • travelling across the region to visit apprentices in the workplace and supporting them to achieve their qualifications

If you can demonstrate the following, then we’d love to hear from you:

  • relevant industry experience and qualifications
  • chartered accountant status is desirable but not essential and other qualifications will be considered (AAT level 4 as a minimum)
  • an assessing qualification (or be willing to work towards one) and have a proven track record of helping learners to achieve their full potential
  • excellent communication skills and be prepared to work as part of a supportive team to deliver an outstanding experience for learners
  • previous experience of delivering apprenticeships or AAT qualifications is preferred but not essential as full support will be provided

We look forward to receiving applications from highly motivated and committed individuals and as a unique and specialist subject area there will be plenty of opportunities for the successful candidate to develop their own repertoire of skills and expertise as part of the role. 

In return, we can offer you:

A competitive FE salary, generous annual leave & pension, access to funded teaching qualifications, apprenticeships and a range of other training courses to support career development, as well as many other benefits.

item.title: ASSESSOR for EYE and EYE T LEVEL
item.description:
East Sussex College is a people-centric, values-driven, ambitious and inclusive Further Education College with over 1,300 colleagues and over 5500 students. We offer a broad curriculum including A Levels, T-levels, work based, 14-19, HE and adult programmes with campuses in Eastbourne, Hastings, Lewes and Newhaven.  This is an exciting time to join us as we grow and develop even stronger pathways for our students and communities. 

ASSESSOR for EYE and EYE T LEVEL    

College location: Lewes

Annual salary: Up to £17.50 per hour (including holiday pay).

Hours:   Sessional hours contract (approximately 474 per year).

Closing date: 8th December 2024.

             This exciting role will include:

  • visiting placement settings to complete observations of learners across Level 2 and Level 3 provision offered with CACHE/NCFE including the T-Level

If you can demonstrate the following, then we’d love to hear from you:

  • extensive industry experience or be able to evidence outstanding levels of performance within their career to date
  • degree level qualification or higher within the field of Early Years Education and possess an assessor's qualification
  • recent experience of assessing in early years placement settings, learners are assessed for competence and skills-based learning in a variety of early years settings

The department is committed to upholding the high standards expected of students progressing into the sector and the expectation of the successful applicant is that they will share these values and complement the team’s ambition to produce outstanding practitioners of the future.

In return, we can offer you:

A competitive FE salary, generous annual leave & pension, access to funded teaching qualifications, apprenticeships and a range of other training courses to support career development, as well as many other benefits.

item.title: CHEF SUPERVISOR
item.description:
East Sussex College is a people-centric, values-driven, ambitious and inclusive Further Education College with over 1,300 colleagues and over 5500 students. We offer a broad curriculum including A Levels, T-levels, work based, 14-19, HE and adult programmes with campuses in Eastbourne, Hastings, Lewes and Newhaven.  This is an exciting time to join us as we grow and develop even stronger pathways for our students and communities.  

CHEF SUPERVISOR    
College location: Lewes
Annual salary: Circa £23700 per annum (subject to qualifications, experience & skills)
Hours: Full time, 37 hours per week, full year, permanent contract. 
Closing date: 6th December 2024
 
This exciting role will include:

The college refectories are very busy catering operations offering a food service to our students, staff, and visitors to the College. Most of the time the hours will be daytime but on occasions, it will require providing catering for the commercial activities which take place in the evenings and weekends.

As a Commis Chef, you will be working as part of a multi-site refectory team and will be responsible for the preparation and serving of all meals and beverages to customers, ensuring that the kitchen and service areas are clean and tidy, and ensuring health and safety regulations are followed.

You will lead a small team day to day and support with cashing up and banking. 

If you can demonstrate the following, then we’d love to hear from you: 
•    you are passionate about food 
•    you are able to deliver great quality products

In return, we can offer you:
A competitive FE salary, generous annual leave & pension, access to funded teaching qualifications, apprenticeships and a range of other training courses to support career development, as well as many other benefits. 

To Apply and view the Job Description & Person Specification, please register or log in and complete the online form via the 'Apply' link below.
